title: Candlesticks And Covers, mid-18th century
description: Pair of porcelain elephants mounted as candlesticks (parts a and c) with covers (parts b and d).  Standing Elephants with dark gray raised trunks, white tusks; skin painted with short gray lines, denser on backs.  Each elephant on a scrolled gilt bronze base with attached urn-shaped, handled nozzle on a fringed cushion resting on animal's back.  Each circular cover, with finial of curling leaves and tendrils, fits snuggly into nozzle.

tombstone.epitaph: Candlesticks And Covers, mid-18th century. Porcelain, gilt bronze. 1964-8-1-a/d.
